      • verifySymbols

        private boolean verifySymbols(java.lang.String players,
                              int cont,
                              int times)
        This method verifies that the symbols entered by the user are correct (that they correspond to the default signs and that they are not repeated).
        name: verifySymbols
        pre: The variables players, cont and times are already initialized.
        post: True or false was returned depending of the verifications carried out with the symbols.
        Parameters:
        times - Is an Integer variable that will contains the number of times that a given symbol is encountered in the text string.
        cont - Is an Integer variable that will contain the position of a letter within the text string.
        players - Is a String variable that contains all the symbols of the players. players!="", players!=null.
        Returns:
        a boolean specifying correct, a variable that indicates if all the symbols that were entered are correct.

      • searchPlayer

        private boolean searchPlayer(java.lang.String p,
                             char s,
                             int cont,
                             int times)
        This method verifies that a certain symbol isn't repeated (that another player has the same) in the whole text string.
        name: searchPlayer
        pre: The variables p, s, cont and times are already initialized.
        post: True or false was returned depending of the result of the verification.
        Parameters:
        times - Is an Integer variable that will contains the number of times that a given symbol is encountered in the text string.
        cont - Is an Integer variable that will contain the position of a letter within the text string.
        p - Is a String variable that contains all the symbols of the players. p!="" p!=null.
        s - Is a char variable that contains all the symbols of the players. p!='' p!=null.
        Returns:
        a boolean specifying find, a variable that indicates if a certain symbol that was entered is correct.

      • verifyData

        private boolean verifyData(int rows,
                           int cols,
                           int snakes,
                           int ladders,
                           java.lang.String players)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method verifies that the number of rows, columns, snakes and ladders entered by the user is correct.
        name: verifyData
        pre: The variables rows, cols, snakes, ladders and players are already initialized.
        post: True or false was returned according to the verification.
        Parameters:
        snakes - Is an Integer variable that contains the number of snakes for the game.
        ladders - Is an Integer variable that contains the number of ladders for the game.
        rows - Is an Integer variable that contains the number of rows for the game.
        cols - Is an Integer variable that contains the number of columns for the game.
        players - Is a String variable that contains the players for the game. p!="" and p!=null.
        Returns:
        a boolean specifying verify, a variable that indicates if the number of rows, columns, snakes and ladders are correct.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException -
        thrown if... 1. A local file that was no longer available is being read.
        2. Any process closed the stream while a stream is being used to read data.
        3. The disk space was no longer available while trying to write to a file.
        java.lang.InterruptedException -
        thrown when a thread is waiting, sleeping, or otherwise occupied, and the thread is interrupted, either before or during the activity.
